results.title: WOW: women of the world
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, World Council of Churches and Hubley Studios
results.brief_description: Looks at the evolution of human liberation from the era of male and female hunters in professional and personal relationships. This is an interesting, inventive animated film.

results.title: Woven in time
results.creator_credit: Robert Wishlaw and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Would You Like to Fly?
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
results.brief_description:
This film was produced by John Kingsford-Smith, nephew of the renowned aviator Charles Kingsford-Smith. John Kingsford-Smith became a successful and prolific producer of documentaries from 1948 to the 1980s. During this time he produced 327 sponsored films and commercials and played a key creative role in all of them (as writer, director, cinematographer or editor).

This film is a combination of his two passions, aviation and filmmaking; one may wonder how many people were spurred on to learn how to fly after watching this film!

results.title: Would you like gravy with that?
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work depicts the views of students, teachers and the filmmakers on the state of the De La Salle College canteen. The owner of the canteen is interviewed, as well as students and teachers who use the canteen.

results.title: Would you kiss a naked man? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: R. Alan Gough, Mary McLeod and Northern Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in sexuality”.
Demonstrates that sexuality and nudity are a natural part of an honest relationship between two people who care for one another by presenting a dramatized interlude between two teenagers in which they discuss the meaning of their relationship and engage in sexual play. From the series “Concepts in Sexuality”.

results.title: Would I lie to you = la verite si je mens
results.creator_credit: Thomas Gilou, Manuel Munz, Farid Lahouassa, Aissa Djabri, Les Productions Jacque Roiffeld, Orly Films, M6 Films, France Z and Vertigo Productions
results.brief_description: No job, no home, no family; Eddie (Richard Anconina) has hit rock bottom. One day, as he is walking through Le Sentier (the rag trade district of Paris) he is attacked by a gang of hustlers. Rescued by Victor Benzakem (Richard Bohringer), a successful rag-trader who mistakes Eddie for a Sephardic Jew, Eddie is offered a job. Only too happy to seize an opportunity to start over, Eddie (who is a gentile) tries his best to maintain the pretence of his adopted ‘jewishness’. From the fabric warehouse, Eddie is given an opportunity to observe the rites and secret hand shakes of the flashy, fast talking garment district: a melting pot of race, religion and culture. His eyes also catch the beauty of his employer’s daughter, Sandra (Amira Casar). In order to draw her attention, Eddie decides to cut loose and start his own business. Starting with the classic story of the stranger who finds himself in a community he knows nothing about, Thomas Gilou’s film presents a seldom-seen look into the lives and customs of France’s many ethnic groups. Cast includes Richard Anconina, Amira Casar, Vincent Elbaz, Elie Kakou, Richard Bohringer, and Jose Garcia.
results.title_for_label: Would I lie to you = la verite si je mens

results.title: Would I ever like to work
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Shannon, Len Chatwin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Joan is a welfare mother with seven children. Originally from the Maritimes, she now lives in Montreal. She would like to work as a waitress, and feels she’d be a better mother if she could. But day care costs more than she can afford.

results.title: Wot! no art
results.brief_description: An analysis of British society since 1945, and the relationship or lack thereof, of art to the people. Deals with the problem of people understanding and accepting “modern art”. “Art must be thought of as a basic human need, instead of a luxury that our society can only just afford”
